annotations: boeing will fly high tomorrow $ba boeing will go up 510 after their earnings report case 1 the 737door scandal was solely due to human error not all of the bolts were used on the door nor were the bolts properly tightened thus causing the door to rip off the plane midflight we are talking about one case people one case but the media loves to criticize boeing whenever anything happens the company is under a magnifying glass prior to earnings this is intentional to drive the stock down at a cheaper price for big players to scoop up shares at a discount like me case 2 there are rumors that alaskan air is going to cancel its order for the 737 however that s all it isa rumor nobody in this industry actually believes that flights have already resumed normal operations and china has announced that they will be buying more boeing planes case 3 boeing has announced a safety investigation on its assembly line they have hired a top executive to lead this investigation but you have to reverseanalyze what this actually means the truth is that if boeing were expecting to report an earnings loss they would not have initiated a safety commission consider the opportunity cost of running such an investigation because they have made so much money they realize they can afford to allocate funds to this investigation even if it may seem unnecessary just to appease the media and get them off their backs case 4 wall street has not fully grasped the situation in the middle east and the rise of various proxy wars and escalation since the october 7th attacks on our ally in the middle east in fact an article has just come out stating that the militaryindustrial complex has achieved recordhigh sales and this naturally includes boeing but no everyone is focused on omg a door came off mid flight case 5 boeing s recent stock decline is driven by emotional retail investors despite widespread concerns and rumors hedge funds anticipate a significant earnings beat once this becomes evident after boeing releases its earnings report the stock is expected to rebound strongly as sellers retreat and buyers capitalize on the undervalued opportunity case 6 finally i m just going based on vibes with that being said on the offshoot that boeing goes up north of 15 i will call my local boeing office and offer to fully fund an office pizza party edit to the guy who posted the bearish boeing post shortly after me you are the true regard not me you or watch theta gang kill us both

market and public is grossly misunderstanding and overestimating the impact of feds action first of all with all the talk about tightening we are barely at 125and the goal seems to be around 225 what kind of tightening is that 25 is still extremely low historically speaking how about tapering and reducing the balance sheet well that may sound scary but all the fed is doing is slowly unwinding by stopping to add new assets to the balance sheet they are not really unloading much at all now even if the fed decided to unload it 23 of the balance sheet is just treasury that s pointless so how about the remaining 13 that s about just under $3 trillion in asset the market can easily absorb it there is so much money sitting on the sideline there is over $2 trillion parked in overnight repo and let s not forget the $35 trillion that s sitting in cash in 401k retirement funds that s about to enter the marketed by early july that s over $5 trillion in liquidity that banks hedge funds retirement funds have that are ready to buy i think the market is overestimating the impact of feds current action

121622 spy es futures and tesla weekly market recap and analysis well while not all history repeats itself the history of quad witching days opening pretty red continues however this one is the first quad witching day of 2022 that did not close higher than its opening price i was able to secure a nice profit on a 0dte am spx contract this morning i really anticipated today to turn around more than it did but instead we ended up with a very bloody day and an eod shorts covering rally x200b because i like to find trends in this market i did assess to see if there was an correlation with the monday following quad witching day and there really is not two of the three quad days closed green for a 667 probability that monday closes green one opened big green one opened big red and one opened flat so there really is no telling what mondays opening will bring but we could expect a green close x200b yesterday i mentioned that today felt oddly similar to the september leading quad witching time period interestingly enough from the peak of monday september 12th till the bottom of friday september 16th quad witching day we had about a 72 drop from tuesday december 13th cpi day to today friday december 16th quad witching day we had about a 72 drop from high to low in price action if we look at the monday following septembers quad day we saw a nice deep red open at 09 however spy rallied to close at 078 the biggest difference here is that the week following quad witching was cpi week does that mean we see a red open and a rally or without fomc and really no big news events after a massive 72 drop from the opening on cpi day to the lowest part of today are we finally going to see a bounce well if we take a look at the daily candle while hard to see cause of the black trend line it is actually a dragonfly doji candle which in a down trend should signal a short term bottom in addition unless spy was to open at 3779 15 or lower on monday that black 4 day drop resistance line will be broken at open this should open up the upside for spy now a taking a look at the last few days here a 15 red open doesn t sound that crazy but after 4 pretty impressive days of straight selling i would be slightly surprised to see a 5th day of selling with no relief bounce this sell off today also filled the almost month long gap at 38114 from november cpi we now have a gap to the upside from 38658 to 38789 and 39525 to 39631 while i would have suspect a bigger break down to test a stronger more established support at 380 intraday today we put in almost 25 hours of price action bouncing on around the 381 area this area established itself as strong support x200b now taking a look at the weekly chart here things are kind of a mixed bag from an interesting data stand point todays total high to low range was $2945 which makes it 2nd largest high to low range of the year next to the week of september 12th which was $2962 if you remember above i mentioned that also was the last quad witching week so the question now remains is this the short term top or did we just reconfirm support on the daily chart i mentioned that i suspected after that impressive 4 days straight of selling for a total 72 high to low drop that we should be do for some sort of relief bounce now on the weekly we have an interesting case here on one hand we did very clearly break through that 2022 bear market resistance line that s the dark thicker green line on the daily and weekly so that should signal that we are going to see a more meaningful push higher however as you can see on this daily candle there was a massive wick and we closed out an impressively large gravestone doji i said for the last two weeks and especially after fomc that until we broke the rising wedge and lost 3901 on the daily channel i was not bearish well we officially lost the rising wedge and lost 3901 losing those signaled to me that we should see a break down to that key support area of 370 to 380 which we hit today when we touched 381 however this gravestone doji on a down trend that last 3 weekly candles have made a lower low actually could signal a short term bottom and a bounce for next week i see two scenarios well maybe three the first scenario is that 381 was our local bottom and we go back to test resistance if we test 3901 which is a major daily and weekly resistance and break through then most likely we are looking at a gap fill up in the mid 390s there is a scenario where we could see another test of that 4052 to 410 area however i do not think we see that big of a breakout the second part of this scenario is that we retest 3901 resistance reconfirm it as resistance and then start our breakdown into the 370s next week the second scenario is that 41049 was the official top of this cycle and we are starting our next leg down much like the structure of the september to october breakdown if this is the start of the next leg down then i would be eye by eoy to middle of january a breakdown to the 358 to 364 support area i feel conflicted here the cpi we got this week was surprisingly very bullish and a very good reading it does show at least short term that inflation has peaked and that inflation is slowly coming down however of course it would be extremely improbable that we see a nonstop drop in inflation to the 2 target without any sort of stickiness or meaningful rebound in cpi we had fomc on wednesday which while i wouldn t say this was the most hawkish that jpow has ever been we did get a big of news in the markets that was unexpected however yesterday and today it was said that the markets already were not believing the fed and were revising their targets to the prefomc numbers i thought i had a tweet for this but i cant find it my thesis personally is that we will revisit 3901 resistance before the next leg down however if we were to come down and touch 378 support and hold that that odds of a bounce back to the 390s before a bigger sell off increases after pretty much a month of consolidating in the 390 to 405 range though this could be spy choosing a direction and the start of the next leg down this market for the last month has been so indecisive its really hard to give a concrete yes or no if you look at december 1st and december 13th those were two fake breakouts from the 390 to 405 channel only to fall right back into them while november 17th did touch support right at 3901 we have not had a fake breakdown out of the channel yet x200b remarkably the futures bear channel from that last 4 days doesn t look as impressive as spys does we did see es lose that critical 3910 pivot area but it managed to find support at 3875 next major support is 3835 and then 3805 x200b taking a look at the futures weekly chart here you can see we did finally break that weekly bull channel that dates back to cpi that really should open the downside however we obviously also wicked through the 2022 bear market resistance line too this is where it s a matter of which move is coming next this market just gives us more questions than it gives us answers now a days the once interesting thing though is that futures did bounce right off the 3870 area which is the call side of the jpm collar which expires on december 30th now the last two quarterlies we have seen us breakout over the call side of the collar and by quarterly options expiration we are sitting just above the put which is at 3425 now again history does not predict the future but that is the historical trend for the last two quarterlies this market just leaves us with more and more questions rather than answers unfortunately x200b now taking a look at tesla this is an interesting one today tesla actually despite spys pretty red open was green and more interesting than that today i noted that the overall sell pressure on spy was 23x higher than the sell pressure on tech and nyse today made me wonder if we were seeing a rotation outta spy for some reason and really this whole week i remember thursday it was the same thing that spy outta the gate led the sell off and then by mid morning afternoon tech nyse had joined in an accelerated the sell off now tesla has a ton of patterns going here on the daily we have the wider broad black falling wedge and within that falling wedge we have a red semi narrow bear channel tesla is also well below its daily 8 and daily 20ema x200b taking a look at the tesla sell buy cycles we are currently at our 11th day of the sell off and 246 drop from peak to current low that means of the average length of sell off we are nearly 2x that and we are 46 more than the average sell off cycle length drop the red bear channel and black falling wedge says monday support would be at 144 black falling wedge and 142 red bear channel if we were to see continued selling that would put tesla at day 12 of selling and 27 to 29 from peak to projected trough that would put it right at the longest length and drop of the cycle now if we believe in this being the local bottom we could be looking at about a 4 day 1404 rally that would put us by thursday at 175 x200b tesla however today hit a major support area when it touched 150 this 150 support area is exactly where the red falling wedge with its now 3rd touch and blue falling wedge also its 3rd touch both intersected each other also if we flip back to august 2020 to november 2020 the 150 area was a major resistance that took nearly 3 months for tesla to break through if there is an area that tesla is going to see a meaningful bounce off of its here weekly support 150 148 red falling wedge 145 blue falling wedge 1292 weekly resistance 1689 blue falling wedge weekly 8ema 1757 195 i am long on some 28dte 160c for tesla and i do expect tesla to minimally retest 175 by beginning to middle of next week x200b the vix is again back to being detached from reality which someone made a great point today that until cboe reconfigures how it calculates the vix with the newly introduced 0dte everyday on spy qqq and the overall increase in options being trades short term the vix is most likely going to stay detached from reality and completely useless however the biggest thing i am seeing is that we for the 3rd day in a row despite this huge spy sell off have rejected 237 breakout area until we see vix close back over that 237 and hold that area i really struggle to be bearish on spy also while i understand we had cpi and fomc during this 4 days dump on spy the vix despite a 72 drop on spy closed lower than it did 4 days ago which on most meaningful dumps on spy you should see the vix continue to close higher and higher this is another reason why i feel that we get a meaningful bounce next week because the vix is not ramping up like it did at the previous local bear market rally tops however if spy continues to drop and the vix breaks out over 237 and holds then i might actually believe that the bear market rally is over and that we could be starting our descent to 320 by spring 2023 daily log today was a tough day technical to trade for most of the day through the middle of the day we had spy looking like it wanted to rally which it ended up doing eod however we watched vold just continue to dump hard and harder every time however despite all that i was able to put in a nice green day today i actually looking back had a pretty great week x200b honestly desite how much i enjoy trading and following tesla i continue to somewhat struggle doing so granted this was a high volatile week with cpi fomc and quad witching looking at my weekly recap i had a great week of scalping again putting in a 100 win rate on strictly scalps level to level trading on spy resulted in my highest win rate since ive started tracking my l2l plays in beginning of october the profits were mild though which i mostly relate to the overall smaller daily ranges we are having which result in lower take profits previously 1015 on scalps and l2ls were easily obtained but now taking profits at 35 is about the happy spot before we see theta eat or a rogue reversal as i mentioned struggled on tesla this week so still keeping that in mind going forward on whether i just permenatly rotate it out of the lineup despite how much i enjoy it swing trade wise i took a huge loss this week mostly because i didn t close at 0dte swing on monday at open had i closed that at open i would have had a breakeven to red week when it comes to swings i did a power hour straddle this week which netted some great profits most days this week i believe netted profits for that and that s something i will continue to evaluate going forward fomc cpi lottos ended up netting me some green this week overall a great week of profits and a great week of trading despite the volatility and wildness with 3 big events in one week i am heading out of town for some family time for christmas and will not be trading monday tuesday or wednesday i really wanna disconnect from stuff and enjoy some time uniterrupted by trading with my family however depending what our plans are i may try to shoot out a pre market update and i may attempt to trade the opening hour just going to play that by ear i am swining a 7dte 384c on spy that i plan to close if we get a decent green open on monday otherwise i will just let it ride for the week i am also holding a 28dte 160c on tesla that is down 30 at open as long as i see 1605 64 by friday i will be able to close that green i will most likely unless we see signs of an extremely strong rally close both of those at 1020 profits if they present themselves if i also see things going really bad really fast i will just cut my losses and sit cash until im back trading full time on thursday enjoy your weekend guys and i will see you guys back on thursday

bears we can still have a very red week don t lose hope from on x1 day we won t be going back to normal this article is a look back on the similar 2011 debt ceiling fight in 2011 sp500 drops after debt ceiling raised notice after event 1 in the pic above when the debt ceiling was raised the market still dropped thursday s and friday s bull rally was nothing more than liquidity flowing into equities from bondstreasuries in three months from now we will look back at this point in time as the obvious top from the 2011 debt ceiling timeline wiki july 30 2011 two sources familiar with negotiations between the white house and congressional leaders say the framework of a deal is being put together the framework calls for up to $28 trillion in total deficit reduction over the next decade july 31 2011 president barack obama announced that leaders of both parties had reached an agreement to lift the debt ceiling and reduce the federal deficit separately house speaker john boehner told republicans that they had reached the framework for an agreement160 boehner revealed details of the agreement in a presentation to the house republicans161 august 1 2011 the house passed a bipartisan bill by a vote of 269161 174 republicans and 95 democrats voted yes 66 republicans and 95 democrats voted no 162 august 2 2011 the senate passed the bill by a vote of 7426 28 republicans 45 democrats and 1 independent voted yes 19 republicans 6 democrats and 1 independent voted no 163 president obama signed the debt ceiling bill the same day thus ending fears of a default obama also declared that the bill is an important first step to ensuring that as a nation we live within our means 164 august 2 2011 the date estimated by the department of the treasury that the borrowing authority of the us would be exhausted if the debt ceiling crisis were not resolved45 august 3 2011 the treasury increased the national debt by $238 billion109 edited here is a better pic of sp500 timeline during and after the 2011 debt ceiling resolution

steel partners managment is attempting to screw over shareholders steel partners splp is probably a name most around here are are not familiar with it s a diversified holding company operating in segments such as diversified materials enegry and financial services the majority of shares is held by insiders and it s thinly traded what s interesting about the company is an announcement they made on 1214 which effectivley amounts forcing small shareholders to sell specifically they announced a 1 for 12 500 reverse spilt followed immediately by a 12 500 for 1 forward split this is scheduled to take place on 182024 according to their press release of the announcement no fractional units will be issued in connection with the reverseforward unit split instead the company will pay cash without interest to any unitholder who would be entitled to receive a fractional unit as a result of the reverseforward unit split unitholders who hold fewer than 12 500 units immediately prior to the reverse unit split will be paid in cash without interest an amount equal to such number of company common units held multiplied by volumeweighted average price for the ten consecutive trading days immediately preceding the effective date of the reverseforward unit split in other words if you own fewer than 12 500 you will be forced out of the stock the publicly available float will decrease in aggregate by the total amount of shares held by shareholders owning under 12 500 shares and well good luck getting back in following the forward split as the pice will in all likelihood be higher due to the reduced share count and lack of available shares to buy since the shares are very thinly traded there s a possiblity of this stock moving higher leading up to the split shareholders just under the 12 500 mark will want to increase their holdings above the threshold to avoid being taken out and since shareholders who have no intention of rising above the level will be taken out anyway they ll likely just wait for the split to be paid out rather than selling before it aside from the interesting techinical setup this is an extremely hostile corporate action directed at small shareholders if the company wants to take them out they should offer a fair price

unexplained leaks and russia s state gas giant threatened to stop sending fuel through ukraine raising nerves about europe s ability to get through winter without rationing natural gas suspicious leaks on two russian gas pipelines in the baltic sea are likely the result of sabotage officials in denmark germany and poland have warned heightening concerns over the vulnerability of europe s energy infrastructure europe had filled up gas stores at a rapid clip in recent months even after russia cut supplies a move european officials describe as an economic attack designed to weaken their support for ukraine tuesday s developments led traders to brace for further disruption to russian gas exports which could drain stockpiles to precariously low levels over winter prices rose 20 a gas damaged them to boost gas prices and hurt the european economy the kremlin said it was concerned by the news and called for an investigation hours later state gas giant gazprom pjsc said moscow might tesla dd ford s mache a examination of tesla s competition with $tsla implications tldr upfront upcoming ev competition is the driving dd behind the tesla bear narrative that ev competition will show up market competition will drive ev prices and therefore $tsla margins down to industrynorms i think this reasoning is flawed ford s unprofitability with the mache provides a window into what the competition is facing and why tesla is very likely to retain unlimited demand and see robust gross margin growthinsulated from the effects of market competitionfor several years until 20262028 argument fords issues with ev profitability link ford cfo says inflation has erased mustang mache profits but isn t hurting demand cnbccom is a proxy for legacy auto s outlook writ large ford s tesla killer is their mach e which is a bev full battery crossover suv however recently ford announced that they get zero profit from sales of their mach e price information is below the standard range rwd 68kwh battery 230 miles epa range the lowest $ base model is $42 895 before dealer markups and delivery fees the extended range 88kwh 300 miles epa the lowest $ long range model is $52 000 before dealerdelivery fords lack of mache profitability is very interesting because the car is highly priced while also benefiting from several costlowering factors $7 500 us federal ev subsidy ford has yet to hit the 200 000 vehicle cap for the $7500 at which point it gradually decreases tesla buyers do not qualify for any ev tax credits right now made in mexico with cheaper nonunionized labor usage of large pouchstyle batteries which are cheaper but lowerquality a more batteryefficient car formfactor as compared to a truck meaning less batteries for a desired range and therefore lower cost of production if ford is unprofitable with a highpriced ev benefiting from $7 500 made in mexico with lower priced components how are they going to be profitable with the f150 lightning the f150 lightning will be made by union labor at us labor prices have a lessefficient form factor truck aerodynamics are very bad have higher user battery needs towing range f150 lightning loses 50 of its range when towing a 23foot airstream trailer add to this coldweather battery reductions heating needs going up inclinesthe trucks 230 mile range s real drivable radius when towing can get extremely limited very quickly see a gradually reduced subsidy amount $7 500 $3750 $1875 it is very possible that the f150 lightning begins to see razorthin profit margins or none at all over the near future additionally ford has additional issues it has to tackle growing percentages of ev sales will reduce dealership income most of which is derived from maintenance and repair leading to more pervasive agreement which to me shows that twitter is a great deal first the disclaimer this is not investment advice or legal advice i am obviously retarded and if you listen to me so are you some background much of this you probably know elon musk is buying at $5420 a share current price is below $49 and buying at $49 makes you a more than 10 return on your capital assuming the deal doesn t fall through the risk of the deal falling through is why twitter isn t trading at exactly $5420 right now in addition to the risk of having capital tied up we can see the merger agreement now it s technically a merger for reasons that don t matter but realistically elon is buying the company so pretend it s just an acquisition actually reviewing the agreement reveals the upside the closing is supposed to occur by october so capital invested should be tied up for less than six months there are seven basic ways this agreement can fall apart 1 elon and twitter both agree to go separate ways 2 elon materially breaches his obligations and twitter decides to terminate 3 twitter materially breaches its obligations and elon decides to terminate 4 twitter gets a better offer and takes it 5 some government agency holds up the deal 6 the shareholders reject the deal 7 it s just impossible to get the deal done and it s really nobody s fault but it took way too long if a party is at fault for the deal falling apart it generally speaking has to pay the other a billion dollars twitter s obligations under this agreement are very pedestrian for a $44 billion deal i ve seen single digit million dollar real estate refinancing deals that are more cumbersome so out of the ways this deal can fall apart we can basically rule out all but one twitter is not going to get a better offer and if they did that would be good not bad since we d get a better return on the investment twitter is not going to back out of the deal the board already agreed to it which was almost certainly based on discussion with big shareholders they ve also clearly decided this is best for the company and the idea that they would intentionally back out now makes no sense twitter also isn t going to screw this up their obligations under the deal are too minimal and the idea that they make the deal fall apart is very unlikely relatedly a government agency is not going to block the deal and it s not going to be impossible for this deal to be completed nothing is certain in life but those two things are about as close to certain as it gets so we re left with basically one way this deal falls apart which is that elon screws it up right now there are tons of stories out there saying oh elon already breached the deal which are making investors more skeptical that skepticism makes little sense first off elon s tweets do not breach the agreement if you read the words and think carefully about what he tweeted you ll see that the reporters who say otherwise are being sloppy and even if elon were tweeting in violation of the agreement it s not realistic to think twitter would actually back out of the deal on that basis are they going to pass on the deal of a lifetime because elon said mean things about them no so the deal can fall apart either because elon changes his mind or somehow isn t able to get financing elon clearly isn t too worried about making sure i s are dotted and t s are crossed because he s agreed to this merger agreement that is pretty easy for twitter to me this shows that he really wants to own twitter although people talk about scenarios where he uses a deal falling apart to turn a profit that makes no sense if elon backs out there is absolutely no way he makes money he can t just sell twitter for a profit right now without making sec filings which would tank the stock and even if he could based on his basis and the current trading value he would lose money when you re factoring in the $1 billion divorce fee while his financing could fall through it would require a lack of creativity on his part he has enough leveragable assets that he can find a way to buy twitter even if tesla poofed out of existence which obviously won t happen elon s spacex value alone is more than $50 billion as i said above you can see from the way the merger agreement is drafted that he wants twitter so while there are reasons to be concerned elon will mess up or back out they aren t really good reasons lastly if elon backs out he pays twitter $1 billion which is roughly 50 of twitter s cash on hand and would represent nearly 10 of their assets by book value $1 billion may not be a lot of money for elon but it actually is for twitter that s a massive cash infusion which will help the company so the downside is somewhat limited because even in a scenario where elon backs out twitter s financials suddenly look materially better so there you go it s a really good deal the potential downside is limited while the deal can fall through it s not very likely secgov ubs to pay $25 million to settle sec fraud charges involving complex options trading strategy ubs to pay $25 million to settle sec fraud charges involving complex options trading strategy for immediate release 2022117 washington dc june 29 2022 the securities and exchange commission today announced that ubs financial services inc has agreed to pay approximately $25 million to settle fraud charges relating to a complex investment strategy referred to as yes or yield enhancement strategy according to the sec s order ubs marketed and sold yes to approximately 600 investors through its platform of domestic financial advisors from february 2016 through february 2017 the order finds that during this time ubs did not provide its financial advisors with adequate training and oversight in the strategy and although ubs recognized and documented the possibility of significant risk in yes investments it failed to share this data with advisors or clients as a result the order finds some of ubs s advisors did not understand the risks and were unable to form a reasonable belief that the advice they provided was in the best interest of their clients when investors suffered losses many of them along with their financial advisors expressed surprise and closed their yes accounts advisory firms are obligated to implement appropriate policies and procedures to ensure all parties involved in the sale of complex financial products and strategies have a clear understanding of the risks those products present said osman nawaz chief of the division of enforcement s complex financial instruments unit as fiduciaries advisers also must make suitable recommendations to their clients complex products can present unique risks and the sec will remain vigilant and continue to take action to protect those who invest in these products from misconduct ubs consented to the entry of the sec s order finding that it violated sections 2062 and 2064 of the investment advisers act of 1940 and rule 20647 without admitting or denying the sec s findings ubs agreed to a ceaseanddesist order a censure and to pay disgorgement of $58 million and prejudgment interest of $14 million which is deemed satisfied by payments made to investors in related arbitration proceedings ubs also agreed to pay a civil penalty of $174 million which it will undertake to distribute to harmed investors pursuant to the fair fund provisions of the sarbanesoxley act of 2002 the sec s investigation was conducted by james f murtha jonathan c shapiro and brent s mitchell and was supervised by reid a muoio of the complex instruments unit with assistance from timothy k halloran of the trial unit

in the long term we are all dead in the short and intermediate term we are all screwed the cpi sure hit it out of the park today exceeding every expectation and destroying the notion that inflation has peaked already shortly afterwards the consumer sentiment number came in at a record low of 502 down 14 from may the fed meets next week and apparently 75 basis points may be on the table it should oh and the first big chunk of assets from the fed s balance sheet is going to roll off on the 15th resulting in godknowswhat reaction in the bond markets the economic turmoil is just getting started and there doesn t appear to be any signs of things changing looking over the cpi report the numbers are way worse than even the headline number suggests may came in at 1 mom signaling that double digit inflation may be in our future the food category was up 12 for the month and many segments are showing mid teens increases yoy a third of the overall weighting of the cpi is shelter which is ridiculously underreported at 55 average rents have gone up 15 and home prices 20 in the last year what would this number look like if properly calculated consumer sentiment has always been more of a soft economic number given that it is based on feel rather than hard numbers but a decline that puts the figure below both 2008 and 1999 is nevertheless startling when you add anecdotal evidence to the equation it becomes even more real layoffs hiring freezes and recinided jobs offers are just a portion people are pessimistic about housing purchases gas prices and energy costs to name a few the thing about sentiment is that it can become powerful enough to actually change the more hardened economic numbers if people feel that everything is more expensive they may feel poorer and spend less as a result even if their budgetary reality is not as bad as it seems it can become a self fulfilling prophecy and then there are the financial markets despite the recent beatings that most financial instruments have taken since the end of last year qqq and spy are still about 20 higher than prepandemic levels keep in mind that we are currently in a highly inflationary period at the start of a rate hike cycle with the fed beginning to unwind its massive balance sheet unlike prepandemic there still appears to be a lot farther that asset prices can fall the reason that these issues aren t going to go away anytime soon is due to my new favorite term excessive savings this term has popped up quite a bit recently and refers to the amount of savings that households have compared to the pre stimulus days most projections put this number in the $2 trillion range it s funny that higher savings rates are now viewed as an economic problem on the one hand it is this cash that has helped spur the inflation that is currently devouring purchasing power on the other hand this excess cash is going to keep inflation higher for longer as people spend down their savings until they reach a level of discomfort that causes them to pull back that may take awhile to add one more ingredient to the shit sandwich that we are staring down how much leverage is there actually being employed in our financial markets we all got a deserved laugh at bill hwang blowing up billions using ridiculous leverage in his opaque family office dealings his mentors at tiger global management are down 50 making one wonder what type of risk they have on their books elon leveraged his tsla shares to buy twitter michael saylor from mstr leveraged a balance sheet full of fake internet money to get loans to buy more fake internet money the big guys are doing these types of things but what about the small fish there was a hilarious post the other night about someone who sold their house and instead of paying
